titleStmt.title: Oliver W. Root to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1145

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
Newport Nov 27. 1865.
Thomas E. Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky
Dr Sir

I enclose your requisition and other papers upon the Gov of Wisconsin for the rendition of one Claudius Tift. The requisition was thought to be informal as you will see from the opinion of the atty General of Wisconsin which I enclose. So far as the affidavit, upon which the requisition was founded, is concerned I think that all the objections taken to it, by the atty General have been corrected in the new one enclosed.

The Agent went all the way to Madison Wisconsin saw the Gov & atty Gen iin person & has returned. He will return to Wisconsin, for the party charged, just so soon as your Excellency will cause the papers to the forwarded
Hoping that it may please you to direct that this matter may be discharged with promptness

I remain Your Excellency's
most obdt servant
Oliver W. Root
County atty.
